task_summary: Perceive the T-block and goal outline, approach and align to the block, establish gentle contact with the circular end-effector, push the block along a straight direction toward the fixed target, verify alignment at the goal, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace into a marked target outline. The behavior prioritizes robust perception, careful approach, contact establishment without grasping, a single straight push, and verification near the goal before retreat. Control and observation run at 10 Hz, so action timeouts use short bins consistent with rapid cycles.
preconditions: Camera view contains both block and goal outline
Planner has permission to operate at table height
stepwise_plan: Align push direction relative to the block
Lower until contact to create a stable pushing interaction
Set yaw for desired push direction
Execute a straight push toward the goal
Verify alignment at the goal outline
success_criteria: Blockâ€™s footprint overlaps the goal outline within small tolerance
No loss of contact during push
Robot ends safely clear of objects
failure_and_recovery: Early contact or slip: re-approach and re-align then push again
Blocked path: retreat, re-align, and attempt reduced distance push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is aligned at the goal and the robot has retreated to a safe offset.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect T-block pose with bounded timeout and retry wrapper.
Detect goal outline pose with bounded timeout and retry wrapper.
Move above the block to a safe pre-contact height.
Planar approach to align end-effector to push face of the block.
Descend slowly until contact establishes a stable pushing interface.
Orient tool yaw to align with desired push direction.
Execute straight push of the block toward the goal.
Verify and fine-align near the goal outline.
Back off to a safe distance after completion.

failure_modes: Slip during push causing orientation error
Insufficient push distance due to friction
recovery_strategy: Retry perception up to three times
Retreat and re-align before a new push
Reduce push distance and repeat sequence
Re-orient yaw then attempt another push
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue goal outline, not gray/green as described; metadata keeps instruction verbatim while BT is grounded to the visible scene.
Single straight push is sufficient; no complex multi-segment path is modeled.
10 Hz guidance is reflected indirectly via short timeout bins; no direct port maps exist.

expected_success_criteria: Block center within the goal outline and orientation visually matched
